text: Morning all. I am trying to use groupBy with blog topics.. but I am having a hard time getting the right info output..
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/FBJGHC31V/-.html|Untitled>
This code outputs `[Credit Union] Testimonials`
Any help is appreciated

Hey all, I’m currently working on a site in where we are using individual blogs for multiple project categories (retail, commercial, etc). I built a module on the homepage and used the blog field to be able to select the corresponding blog to the section. However, we can’t get the link to work at all. The blogs are displaying as drafts on the site, but the links to them in my advanced menus and nav works. Anyone else have this problem, or am I just using the wrong selector in my code?
<@UB7MPUTJ4> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/UB7MPUTJ4/FBJEBDMPY/here_s_my_code_.txt|here's my code:>

Hi community, I am struggling making a gallery module export_to_template into a local module. Although I have everything added correctly {% gallery "image_slider_hero" export_to_template_context=True %} with or without export_to_template_context=True the gallery is not editable in the editor, not even showing as a module. Have this happened to anyone else? any suggestions? Kind regards :slightly_smiling_face:
can you share a link to the live page?

for anyone referencing back to this later, we changed group_list to group.list -- as for the group.grouper displaying an odd string, we did a replace to the [ and ] that was how the work around happened
Is the slider showing up on the live page?
you need a comma after image_slider_hero"
{% gallery "image_slider_hero", export_to_template_context=True %}
I have tried with comma as well. Is not showing but I presume because there is nothing to show. but for sure is not showing in the module list when you edit the page

Can you try adding some other modules other than this, like some basic rich text and images in teh export to template context? If they aren't showing up also then I think there is something wrong with the template or something else
if the modules work, then I'm guessing that you need more of the widget_block
in your item to do this. I have never used the gallery so I don't have expereince with this exact tag

yep, so neither a rich text doesn't work in that way. do you think is a limitation of external hubl code? because if I add a rich text module to the local module, works just fine but I  try to generate a module inside the local module. is just not displaying...
Where are you trying to add this?
into a local module on the DM2
Yeah, I'm not sure that is going to work but I haven't tried that. I was thinking you were adding this to the template.
VERY interesting

well, I built it like that hoping that will lift off some repeatable extra work. the structure repeats on other pages but has different copy. unfortunately didn't took in consideration that hubl code is not going to work like that anymore and ended up creating me more work :joy:  Thanks for your help though
I wish it turned out differently for you!
I thought I could use no_wrapper=True in the post loop for blogs for content.name -- No? Is there a way to get rid of the span that is in there?
that should work, though content.name shouldn’t return tags in the first place — maybe a marketer snuck in some html into a field they shouldn’t have?
I'm on the detail page. I was confused
so you figured it out?
Yeah I have it working properly on the listing page
On the detail page it is being shown inside a wrapper so I'll investigate that when I get to the detail page
